info.description:
This is a formal specification of the Netspend API. ## Authentication The API uses OAuth 2.0 access token to authenticate API requests. API key and secret generated for the app in the portal will be used to create an access token. These access tokens are valid for 24 hours. | Environment | Access Token URL | | ------ | --------- | | Sandbox | https://apis-cert.netspend.com/netspend-api/v1/oauth/accesstoken | | Production | https://apis.netspend.com/netspend-api/v1/oauth/accesstoken | To receive an access token, API clients will POST an API request to one of the above URLs with grant_type parameter set to client_credentials and content-type set to application/x-www-form-urlencoded. It is recommended that the client ID and client secret from the registered app be passed in as base64 URL encoded string in the Authorization header. To do this a base64 encoding tool can be used to encode the two values together with colon separating them, client_id:client_secret.
The API can be invoked using *curl* like below 

curl -v -X POST "https://apis-cert.netspend.com/netspend-api/v1/oauth/accesstoken" \
 -H "Authorization: Basic eVFqQTQ2MWVWMjl6UUd3Tk9wZDBIenVZdVpGNXRJeko6WWgxVFY0b0FYYWN0YUhybQ==" \
 -H "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded" \
 -d "grant_type=client_credentials"
Sample Response 

access_token: OikMUkfZcv46jcAaiacJ4nHqXvxw
expires_in: 86399
token_type: Bearer
scope: owned_accounts_full
Previous methods of authentication have been deprecated, but are still included in this spec to allow for some transition. ## Headers The API supports the following headers on all API requests, in addition to the standard Authorization header: | Header | Required? | Description | | ------ | --------- | ----------- | | ns-request-id | Yes | UUID, generated by the client, which identifies the request | | ns-request-flow-id | No | Optional ID, generated by the client, used to group together multiple API calls for diagnostics | | ns-session-id | No | UUID, generated by createSession call, to identify a user in a server API call | | ns-location-id | No | Name of the partner's store location, if applicable | | ns-teller-id | No | Name of the teller at the partner's store location, if applicable | The API also supports the following HTTP response headers: | Header | Required? | Description | | ------ | --------- | ----------- | | ns-response-id | Yes | Copy of the ns-request-id header from the request | | ns-duplicate-request | No | For any request that changes server data, "true" indicates this is a duplicate request, "false" indicates this is not a duplicate request, and missing indicates no idempotency detection was done | ## HTTP Status Codes The API may respond to any request with one of the following common HTTP status codes: | Code | Meaning | Description | Schema Object | | ---- | ------- |------------ | ------------- | | 400 | Bad Request | Information from the client was not presented to the API in a proper format | `#/components/schemas/BadRequestError` | | 401 | Unauthorized | The caller could not be successfully authenticated | `#/components/schemas/AuthenticationError` | | 403 | Forbidden | The caller is not authorized to interact with the target resource | `#/components/schemas/AuthorizationError` | | 405 | Method Not Allowed | The method received is not supported by the target resource | None | | | 409 | Conflict | Idempotency conflict (read detailed message in response) | `#/components/schemas/IdempotencyError` | | 415 | Unsupported Media Type | The API currently only supports application/json type requests and responses | None | | 429 | Too Many Requests | (Reserved) The client has exceeded its maximum permitted request rate | Reserved | | 500 | System Error | The system has encountered an error from which it cannot recover |`#/components/schemas/SystemError` | | 503 | Service Unavailable | The system is temporarily unable to respond to requests | `#/components/schemas/ServiceUnavailableError` | ## Idempotency The API will detect duplicate requests that use the same ns-request-id header. This detection is limited to PUT, POST, PATCH, and DELETE requests that can change system data. In the case where a duplicate request is detected the original response will be replayed, and the ns-duplicate-request response header will have the value "true". However, in some cases if a duplicate ns-request-id is presented but the request details are different, a 409/Conflict response will be returned.

get.summary: Do a basic status check for the API's health
get.description: This endpoint checks the API's status: `up` or `partially_up`.

200.description: This response is returned whenever the status is either `up` or `partially_up`.

status.description:
Expected values are the following, but more can be added in future versions.
- up
- down
- unknown
- out_of_service
- partially_up

503.description: This response is returned whenever the status is not `up` or `partially_up`.

post.summary: Create a new account based on an account context.
post.description:
Notes:

- An account context carries with it, directly or by inheritance, 
the included features, terms and conditions, and all else that will be associated with the account.

- For accounts that require extra validation (higher bar for passing fraud concerns) you should pass a `provided_id` and `parent_account_id`.
that has already been Know Your Customer (KYC)-approved.

post.summary: Create a new session
post.description:
Requests the creation of a session, to associate future API calls to an end user.

The `source_type` and `source_id` fields should be set based on the nature of the end user:
- The `source_type` should be set to account, and the `source_id` refer to an account resource ID if the end user is the customer and the account already exists.
- The `source_type` and `source_id` are optional and don't need to be set if the end user is a potential customer who does not currently have an account.
- The `source_type` should be set to `person`, and the `source_id` refer to a person resource ID if the end user is the customer and the person already exists.

account_id.description: This field is deprecated and replaced by source_id and source_type

source_type.description:
Expected values are the following, but more can be added in future versions.
  - account
  - person

get.summary: Retrieve non-secure information about a session
get.description: Note: Non-secure information, also known as authentication factors, relates to how the user authenticated.  For example, the user might have used a password, or logged in using a verified device or biometric such as a touch ID. Information includes the time when a factor was completed.

type.description:
Expected values are the following, but more can be added in future versions.
- password
- biometric
- verified_device

delete.description:
This endpoint deletes the given `session_id`.

Note: After a session has expired, the `session_id` can no longer be used.

patch.description:
This endpoint updates session `source_id` and `source_type`:

- `source_type` is the type of session being created, representing what the session is for.
    - Values can be `account` or `person`.             

- `source_id` is the ID of the `source_type`.

Notes: 

- You can omit `source_type` or `source_id` for anonymous sessions.

- You can only change `source_type` in this progression:

  - anonymous session to `account` or `person` session

  - `account` to `person` session

source_type.description:
Expected values are the following, but more can be added in future versions.
  - account
  - person

post.summary: Create a new person for a new or existing account
post.description:
This endpoint creates a new person on the Netspend platform.

Notes:

- The `encrypted_data` body parameter contains Personally Identifiable Information (PII) such as `date_of_birth` or `government_id`.

- The `identity_context` passed in the request body provides instructions on how to link the person. If the person is to be added to an existing account, then provide an `account_id`.

- If sufficient data is provided in the request, then the server will perform an OFAC and/or KYC verification.

- A failed OFAC or KYC check will *not* cause the request to fail.

patch.description:
This endpoint updates information about an existing `person_id` on the Netspend platform.

Notes:

- The `encrypted_data` body parameter contains Personally Identifiable Information (PII) such as `date_of_birth` or `government_id`.

- The Know Your Customer (KYC) information within the `encrypted_data` body parameter can only be changed if the person's `kyc_status` is set to `unchecked`.  

- For all other KYC statuses, providing a different `date_of_birth` or `government_id` will cause this request to fail.

- If sufficient data is provided in the request, then the server will perform an OFAC and/or KYC verification.

- A failed OFAC or KYC check will *not* cause this request to fail.

Expected values are the following, but more can be added in future versions.
- card_purchase
- card_replacement

amount.description:
Number of base currency units, represented as an integer.
For example, $5.95 USD is represented as 595 (pennies).

action.description:
The action to be taken with regard to this fee. Usually, the partner requests that a fee is to be assessed. There are times when the partner may request an immediate refund on a fee that is assessed, due to a promotion. Expected values are the following, but more can be added in future versions.
- assess
- refund

assessed_by.description:
Describes who will assess the fee. If set to "partner" then Netspend will record that the fee was assessed, but it will not show up as a transaction on the account. Expected values are the following, but more can be added in future versions.
- netspend
- partner

The action to be taken with regard to this fee. Usually, the partner requests that a fee is to be assessed. There are times when the partner may request an immediate refund on a fee that is assessed, due to a promotion. Expected values are the following, but more can be added in future versions.
- assess
- refund

Describes who will assess the fee. If set to "partner" then Netspend will record that the fee was assessed, but it will not show up as a transaction on the account. Expected values are the following, but more can be added in future versions.
- netspend
- partner

This endpoint initializes, but does not execute a request to transfer funds from a partner account (`partner_id`) to a consumer account.

Note: The endpoint validates the deposit and helps ensure that it can be executed.

- netspend
- partner

get.summary: Retrieve the restrictions on an account
get.description: This endpoint returns the restrictions for the given `account_id`.

schema.description: List of restrictions on an account

items.description: Restriction on an account

restriction_type.description:
Expected values are the following, but more can be added in future versions.

  - atm_withdrawal

  - daily_spending_limit

  - mcc

  - monthly_spending_limit

  - weekly_spending_limit

items.description: List of MCC restrictions on an account

anyOf.description:
Expected values are the following, but more can be added in future versions.
- allowed
- disallowed

amount.description:
Number of base currency units, represented as an integer.
For example, $5.95 USD is represented as 595 (pennies).

restriction_value.description:
This field type depends on restriction_type

  - if restriction_type is "mcc" then restriction_value is array like ["5921", "7995"]

  - if restriction_type is "atm_withdrawal" then restriction_value is allowed or disallowed

  - if restriction_type is any of "daily_spending_limit/weekly_spending_limit/monthly_spending_limit" then restriction_value is amount

created_by.description:
Expected values are the following, but more can be added in future versions.

  - parent

- partner

CardEncryptedData.description:
Data varies, depending on the type of card.
Physical card may contain pan.
Virtual card may contain pan, expiration_month, expiration_year, and cvv2.

amount.description:
Number of base currency units, represented as an integer.
For example, $5.95 USD is represented as 595 (pennies).

rate_level.description:
Expected values should be interest rates. Base_rate will be the lower interest rate.  The bonus_rate will the higher interest rate. It requires the cardholder to meet higher criteria than the base_rate. One example could require a predefined number of direct deposits.
The interest rate can toggle from base_rate to bonus_rate depending on cardholder activity like number of direct deposits and amount transferred to savings during the quarter.
- base_rate
- bonus_rate

type.description:
Expected values are the following, but more can be added in future versions.
- card_purchase
- card_replacement

amount.description:
Number of base currency units, represented as an integer.
For example, $5.95 USD is represented as 595 (pennies).

action.description:
The action to be taken with regard to this fee. Usually, the partner requests that a fee is to be assessed. There are times when the partner may request an immediate refund on a fee that is assessed, due to a promotion. Expected values are the following, but more can be added in future versions.
- assess
- refund

assessed_by.description:
Describes who will assess the fee. If set to "partner" then Netspend will record that the fee was assessed, but it will not show up as a transaction on the account. Expected values are the following, but more can be added in future versions.
- netspend
- partner

- "region" is two uppercase letters specified by ISO-3166 alpha-2
Expected values are the following, but more can be added in future versions.
- en_US
- es_US

action.description:
The action to be taken with regard to this fee. Usually, the partner requests that a fee is to be assessed. There are times when the partner may request an immediate refund on a fee that is assessed, due to a promotion. Expected values are the following, but more can be added in future versions.
- assess
- refund

assessed_by.description:
Describes who will assess the fee. If set to "partner" then Netspend will record that the fee was assessed, but it will not show up as a transaction on the account. Expected values are the following, but more can be added in future versions.
- netspend
- partner
